main.project.obfuscation.tests

Class CommasPercentageTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.project.obfuscation.tests.CommasPercentageTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITest

    public class CommasPercentageTest
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITest
    This class handles one of the characteristics of obfuscated code. Obfuscated or malicious JavaScript code tend to contain a number of commas exceeding the norm. The reason for this is that obfuscators (or attackers) usually generate long objects as arrays and strings that contain encoded information or malicious code, separated by commas.

      • isSuspicious

        public boolean isSuspicious(java.lang.String javascriptPath,
                            java.lang.String javascriptCode)
        Main steps of the algorithm: 1. Count the number of commas in code. 2. Divide it by the length of the source getting the proportion. 3. Compare it with threshold proportion.
        Specified by:
        isSuspicious in interface ITest
        Parameters:
        javascriptPath - - path to JavaScript source file.
        javascriptCode - - the input program (as string).
        Returns:
        true if the proportion of commas is large and we suspect the code as obfuscated, false otherwise.
